trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_1<tab>That's some cliff, ain't it? Ye'd never get cargo up an' down that thing without this great bloody mess o' wood an' pulleys.
TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_2<tab>A collection o' freight companies banded together to come up with the Skylift ye see here. I guess ye could call me the “face” o' the operation.

TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_3<tab>Not that I wield aught more authority than the next bloke, ye understand─with Limsa bein' a place built on the ways o' pirates, every bleedin' act is decided by a vote.
TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_4<tab>So my job is settin' up meetin's an' presidin' over the votes. The grease on the wheels, as it were.
TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_100_4<tab>Some days, I'd sooner be drivin' one of them wagons, an' gettin' some <var 1A 02 /var>real<var 1A 01 /var> work done.
TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_5<tab>This operation was set up after the Calamity cracked the very ground, an' raised a cliff clear across middle La Noscea.
TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_6<tab>Ye might rely on cargo ships for deliveries along the coast, but the folk living inland still need our wagons to get through.

TEXT_REGSEASKYLIFT_00071_WYRKRHIT_000_7<tab>This scaffoldin' ain't sturdy enough to hold a fully laden wain, so the ideal solution would be to collapse a section o' the cliff an' make us a ramp. 'Course, no bugger has the time or the resources for that sort of undertakin'. For the time bein', we're stuck usin' what we have.
